messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Oh! Oh my God.
Can you calm down and tell me what's going on, please?
I'm out at the beach right now. We just got struck by lightning!
Do you need police, fire, or medical attention?
I need an ambulance. My boyfriend is not breathing.
Okay, stay on the line. I will connect you.
Baby, say something! Babe, say something!
Where is the emergency?
We're at the beach, past Lanikai. There's a building being built nearby.
Are you with your boyfriend now?
Yes, I'm with him. He's on the ground.
Are there any flames or smoke?
No, there are no flames or smoke.
How many of you were struck by lightning?
Three of us. My boyfriend, the driver, and me.
Is anyone else nearby who can help?
There's a couple of people coming over now.
Okay, I need you to place your hand on your boyfriend's stomach and see if it's going up and down. Is he breathing?
No, I don't think so.
Okay, we need to start CPR. Place your hand on his forehead and tilt his head back. Are you able to do that?
Yes, someone is helping now.
Is there anyone there who's CPR certified?
No, I don't think so.
Keep doing the CPR. Help is on the way. Where exactly are you again?
We're behind Hooters on the beach.
Okay, we'll get someone there as quickly as possible. How is he doing now?
He's trying to breathe. Please hurry.
You're doing great. Just keep trying and stay calm. Help is almost there.
Okay, thank you.
